goals.question: What is the distribution of housing prices in the University District?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of housing prices in the University District and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between the number of bedrooms and the price of a property in the University District?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of the 'bedrooms' field against the 'price' field
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between the number of bedrooms and the price of a property in the University District.

goals.question: What is the most common type of property in the University District?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of property types in the University District and identify any trends.

goals.question: What is the average rating of properties in the University District?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of review scores for properties in the University District and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the distribution of the distance between properties and the University of Washington?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the proximity of properties to the University of Washington and identify any trends or patterns.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['price'] = pd.to_numeric(data['price'], errors='coerce')
    data = data.dropna(subset=['price'])
    plt.hist(data['price'], bins=20, color='green', alpha=0.5)
    plt.axvline(data['price'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Median: {:.2f}'.format(data['price'].median()))
    plt.xlabel('Price')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.legend(loc='upper right')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')
    plt.scatter(data['bedrooms'], data['price'], alpha=0.5)
    plt.xlabel('Number of Bedrooms')
    plt.ylabel('Price')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between the number of bedrooms and the price of a property in the University District?')
    return plt

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['property_type'].value_counts().plot(kind='bar')
    plt.title('What is the most common type of property in the University District?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['review_scores_rating'] = pd.to_numeric(data['review_scores_rating'], errors='coerce')
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8,6))
    ax.boxplot(data['review_scores_rating'].dropna(), vert=False, showmeans=True, meanline=True, labels=['Review Scores'])
    ax.set_title('What is the average rating of properties in the University District?')
    ax.axvline(data['review_scores_rating'].mean(), color='r', linestyle='--', label=f'Mean: {data["review_scores_rating"].mean():.2f}')
    ax.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['distance'] = pd.to_numeric(data['distance'], errors='coerce')
    data = data.dropna(subset=['distance'])
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
    ax.hist(data['distance'], bins=20, color='blue', alpha=0.5)
    ax.axvline(data['distance'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=2, label=f'Median: {data["distance"].median():.2f}')
    ax.set_xlabel('Distance from University of Washington')
    ax.set_ylabel('Frequency')
    ax.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of the distance between properties and the University of Washington?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
